attributes.action: Accept the recommendations of The Neonatal Taskforce.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
After the death of Ivan Cameron, Gordon Brown said , “ Every child is precious and irreplaceable, and the death of a child is an unbearable sorrow that no parent should have to endure.”
  
A Neonatal Taskforce was established last year in response to the National Audit Office's criticism of standards of care for sick babies.  It concluded that they should have one-to-one nursing in intensive care – the same standard already given to adults – in line with recommendations medical organisations have been making for the past 15 years.
 
The Taskforce recommended investment of £89m a year, with one-off costs of £102m, to bring care up to standard. But ministers have refused to allocate any extra money. 

Tiny babies should not be paying the price for the credit crunch. Gordon Brown could prevent other parents from enduring lifelong sorrow by overturning this decision and accepting the Taskforce’s recommendations. We call upon him to do so immediately
